ARABIC: مَا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No nation can advance its appointed time nor can they delay it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: No nation can live beyond its allotted time, or lag behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: No nation can outstrip its term, nor can it put it back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Every nation has an appointed life span.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: No nation can go before its term ends nor stay back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: No nation can advance their term, nor can they delay it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: No people can hasten on their doom nor can they postpone (it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: no nation outstrips its term, nor do they put it back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: No nation can outstrip its term, nor yet postpone it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: no community can advance or postpone its appointed time,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: No community can anticipate their term, nor can they lay behind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No nation can advance its time nor can it defer it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: No people can hasten their term, nor can they delay (it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: No nation can anticipate their term, nor can they delay it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: no nation outstrips its term, nor do they put it back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: No nation can advance its time, nor can they postpone it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No nation will precede its time [of termination], nor will they remain [thereafter].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:43] No community can precede its term, by dying before it, nor be deferred, beyond it (the person [in the second verb yasta’khirūna, ‘be deferred’] is masculine, having been feminine [in the first verb tasbiqu, ‘precede’] because this [masculine plural] takes into account the [plural masculine] content [of the term ‘community’]).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (No nation can outstrip its term) no nation can bring forward the term appointed for its destruction, (nor yet postpone it) to a later date.
